title: Senior Account Executive, Healthcare PR
content:
About Ogilvy
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry. Our health division is one of the largest global networks in healthcare communications and provides strategic, integrated communication solutions for our clients, including many of the biggest names in the pharmaceutical industry. 
Within Ogilvy Health UK there are 200 health specialists working together to solve client’s challenges applying their own areas of specialism such as: public relations, strategy, creative, medical education and brain sciences. This will give you the opportunity to work alongside a broad range of health specialists to deliver truly outstanding work.
There are several ongoing initiatives within Ogilvy Health outside of client work that you can choose to get involved in including our culture and social team and our various DEI groups, created to champion diversity in the industry, our agency and our work.You will discover that we are a very friendly, non-hierarchical, eclectic team, bound together by a desire to do the best work of our lives.
About the Role  
This is an exciting opportunity for a Senior Account Executive with a passion for healthcare PR to join us. You'll be working across the interesting and rewarding therapy area of rare disease. The teams here are well established and have strong existing client relationships. Perhaps your an Account Executive looking for a step up, or you're already a Senior Account Executive but ready for a change and the opportunity to work on exciting global accounts. 
We're a non-hierarchical agency and each team member is given ownership and accountability of specific projects. This role works in a blended team and you'll work closely with your colleagues in medical education - the scientific driver behind everything we do. If you want to be part of a fun, award winning and ambitious team then apply today.We offer flexible hybrid working and are open to speaking with candidates who can comfortably travel to either London, Oxford, or Manchester two days per week.
What You’ll Do 
The range of activities you will undertaken is broad and you'll continue to develop your skills through your meticulous delivery of a variety of projects and campaigns.
Day to day you can expect to - 

Compile accurate contact reports to share with clients 
Participate in account teams, devising and implementing projects and taking ownership for specific actions and activities 
Be an ambassador for our social media offering; ensuring copy, images, channel selection etc. are appropriate and be up to speed with our social media process (e.g. project brief, social media tools, liaison with paid promotion agency, evaluation)
Draft a variety of written materials including press materials, emails and client proposals as required
Assist with accurate estimating, billing, and have an awareness of budgetary status at all times to assist with project profitability
You'll continue to strengthen your understanding of account therapy areas and industry/environment issues that are pertinent to our clients 

What You’ll Need  
We would like to hear from curious individuals who are not afraid to put their ideas forward. 

You're a detail-orientated problem solver, with great organisational skills and you love to get things 'over the line'
You're naturally collaborative and respect the team around you  
You have a passion for healthcare PR and the amazing work that can be done in this space 
You have experience of implementing disease awareness campaigns, brand initiatives and utilising social media.
Good project/programme management skills 

Benefits 


25 days holiday + your birthday off and a paid volunteering day - after 2 years service you can purchase up to an additional 5 days per year
Flexible working 
Enhanced parental leave 
A generous pension scheme - you pay in 4% we pay 6%, following probation contributions are matched up to 10.5% (17.5% in total)
Private medical cover (Bupa) OR Dental cover OR a monthly leisure allowance of £45 to spend on your health & wellbeing 
A fantastic EAP provided by LifeWorks which offers brilliant support, expert advice and specialist counselling
Help at Hand - quick free access to a remote GP, mental health support, physio or a medical 2nd opinion
Free 1-2-1 Coaching - online coaching for your professional or personal growth 
A comprehensive L&D programme 


 


At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
